newsitem.title: malaysia: KL palm oil down at close on China default talk.
newsitem.headline: KL palm oil down at close on China default talk.

text.p: PALM OIL FUTURES PALM OIL PHYSICAL

PALM OIL FUTURES - Talk that China may default nearby contracts triggered late selling and prices ended down on sharp falls in Chicago soyoil. Trading was volatile despite good bargain hunting at around 1,248 to 1,250 (June futures). Next resistance seen at 1,265 and support at 1,240.
PALM OIL PHYSICAL - Weak fundamentals and poor exports eased prices. Interest was seen among products and neabry CPO.
Malaysian palm oil prices weakened sharply in nervous and volatile trading as talk that China may default some nearby contracts triggered late selling, traders said.
They said there were rumours that China could be looking to default some 50,000 tonnes of March/May shipments. No confirmation was available.
June futures fell to a low of 1,241 ringgit before closing at 1,245, down 19 ringgit. It traded between 1,241 and 1,261.
Traders pegged next resistance for the contract at 1,265 with support at 1,240 ringgit.
A sharp fall in Chicago soyoil futures overnight and lack of demand dragged down palm oil prices at the opening but the market rebounded towards midday close.
"Some bargain hunting and low level refiners and millers covering were seen at the lower levels," a trader said.
Chicago's soyoil futures also fell because of confirmation Brazil would not impose an export tax on soy products.
There was also uncertainty over the immediate trend as players were digesting the PORLA's report.

Malaysia's Palm Oil Resgistration and Licensing Authority (PORLA) said at the weekend that end-February stocks were at 722,993 tonnes against trade expectations of 670,000-690,000 tonnes. Exports were at 376,885 tonnes against estimates of 440,000 to 460,000 tonnes.

Among physicals, Mar (south) crude palm ol was offered at 1,280 ringgit against bids of 1,277.50 after trading at 1,280 and 1,277.50. Mar (central) saw offers at 1,270 against bids of 1,265 and Mar (north) at 1,260 against 1,252.50.
Apr (south) was offered at 1,280 with bids at 1,272.50 with early transactions from 1,280 and 1,275, and Apr (central) at 1,270 against 1,265.
Among refined products, Apr RBD palm oil was offered at $542.50 a tonne FOB Malaysia, May/Jun 537.50 and Jul/Aug/Sep at $530. Apr was traded at $545.
